result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matasha M Snow in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.   GPQPA filed.  State offfers Plea to 1 ct del of heroin in case 114 as charged and felony BJ in case 1155 without the repeater enhancer CF for positive UA.   Balance of charges on 3 files DRI including 1334 all counts. State req. 10 yrs wps: 5/5.

Judge completes the plea colloquey.   Defendant pleas GUILTY to both charges and is found GUILTY by the court

PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Def - Req trial date remain in 14CF114, also req bond modification hearing to address cost of bracelet

  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to court and meeting with atty.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
